Posts.Content: No. 23 : "my friend had breast cancer but she had it worse than you!" Like I wanted to compete!!
Posts.Title: Angry !

Posts.Content: Hi Alig58. I had a TM plus second op to obtain clear margins and happy to answer any queries you may have.
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: You're right there, not normal at all. My TM was left side too. I had only ever been in hospital to give birth before and was extremely scared. I have to say the staff were all very kind and understanding and did their best to put me at my ease. It's very strange to be put to sleep and wake up when it's all over but I have to say I was not in pain or uncomfortable and went home the same day. To help me stay calm a friend recommended rescue remedy that you spray on your tongue and it certainly made me feel calmer. Good luck on the 10th, I think the waiting and thinking are worse than the event and after the op, with clear margins, your cancer will be gone! Jan
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: Congratulations Fiona on nearing the end of chemo, definitely "good Friday". Great words, you have a gift for them.  Jan
Posts.Title: Farewell to Chemo!

Posts.Content: Little girl said to her Grandma "how old are you?" "I can't remember" said Grandma. "Well if you look at the label in the back of your knickers, it will tell you!"
Posts.Title: JUST HAVING A LITTLE RANT HERE

Posts.Content: Hi, I'm not as blessed as you in the cup department but my daughter's a G cup and buys her bras from Asda at a tenner a time. She used to buy from Bravissimo but they are much more expensive. She says Asda do under wired as well as sports non wired bras. Hope this helps.
Posts.Title: TM

Posts.Content: Hi Kateandbiz Did you wear your compression sleeve over the tape? Jan
Posts.Title: Lymphodema in arm

Posts.Content: Hi Julia, the sleeve doesn't seem to be helping me much so was interested to read your post. Hope you don't mind me asking but How did you find a suitably qualified practitioner of kinesiology taping? Is it wildly expensive? Thanks Jan
Posts.Title: Lymphodema in arm

Posts.Content: Hi, I also failed to dodge this bullet and am having bit of a tough time with it at the moment. Just thought I'd let you know my GP recommended Avon Skin So Soft dry oil spray to use as an insect repellent. It contains Citronella and is also good for keeping your skin in good condition. Apparently the troops working abroad use it. It is kinder to use than the harsh chemicals found in most insect repellents. I was interested to see that swimming he,led to reduce swelling. Best wishes to all Jan
Posts.Title: Lymphodema in arm

Posts.Content: Hi Lucy (Clump) I'm not going to be much help yet as the tape was only applied for the first time yesterday. I'm going on holiday at the weekend so didn't combine the taping with lymph drainage just in case it upset things but when I get back I'm going to book in for MLD combined with taping. I find the sleeve just keeps things as they are so am searching for something that will improve the lymphoedema. Not sure how the measurements work but I started off at 7%, dropped to 1% which was great but then very suddenly shot up to 27%! I find the taping more comfortable than the sleeve, I too ended up with a glove too for the same reason as you. The taping needs to be renewed roughly every three days, I took my husband with me and he's confident he has learnt how to do it. We also took photos of how the physio applied the tape so we have a pattern to work to. I'll be happy to let you know progress although I do realise there's no quick fix for this condition. Take care Jan
Posts.Title: Lymphodema in arm

Posts.Content: Hi Crystaljuju (Julia), well here I am all taped up for the first time, much more comfortable than the compression sleeve. I didn't opt for MLD at this stage as going on holiday at the weekend so didn't want to risk it but will add that to the mix when I get back.  Fingers crossed for good result. Jan
Posts.Title: Lymphodema in arm

Posts.Content: Thanks, I thought that was the case. Next check at the lymph clinic in July.
Posts.Title: Lymphodema in arm

Posts.Content: My hair has been excruciatingly slow to grow and thicken and has only really done so since my last Herceptin injection nearly 6 months ago. Oh joy! This morning I had to brush out a tangle! Hugs to all, I've not posted much as got all my answers from all of your questions before I got a chance to ask them, thank you.
Posts.Title: Tangles

Posts.Content: I wish I'd known it was possible to request copy letters from the hospital, I paid £45 to get copies from my GP!
Posts.Title: Hospital letters

Posts.Content: Hi Lorraine, I've got 5 more Herceptin to go. One of the nurses said the higher up the thigh and the slower the Herceptin is injected the less painful it is. They also give it to me to hold and warm up before it's injected. This site is great for sharing. I have a really sensitive right foot but hadn't considered it might be the Herceptin. I live in East Devon, about 10 miles from Exeter. Jan
Posts.Title: Are any of you having Herceptin injections?

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, approaching my last Herceptin but unfortunately have developed lymphodema. I've been to the Lymphodema clinic twice now, I wear a compression sleeve and glove all day. In case this is of use to anyone else out there, the nurse at the clinic recommended doing this six minute exercise everyday: . What a great bunch of people on this site!
Posts.Title: Had a bit of a traumatic morning

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, wishing you all the best for tomorrow and a speedy recovery. I'm sure hubby will do an excellent job with the laundry :) . Jan
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, as a TM buddy i was really sorry to read your post, I had no idea this was even a possibility. I remember how shocked I was on my post op check up to hear that I didn't have clear margins and needed a second op so not surprised you shed tears at the news.  I am having a six month post op check up with my surgeon on Thursday and don't really know what to expect at that. I wish you well and quote from a poster I have " you don't know how strong you can be until being strong is the only choice you have" good luck, hugs and best wishes. Jan
